title: (x) Heavy Gothic wood type - Chikamauga, Champion Gothic {Mike F, Tiff}
content:
i’m looking for the face used on this record album from the 1960s (attached).

i believe it’s from the Gothic family by Nesbitt circa 1838. there’s a sample letter on the RIT rob roy kelly site — [http://www.rit.edu/~rkelly/html/05\_obs/obs\_plain1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.rit.edu/~rkelly/html/05_obs/obs_plain1.html "http://www.rit.edu/~rkelly/html/05\_obs/obs\_plain1.html")

as well, there’s gothic 13, which is on the myfonts site —  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gothic-13/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gothic-13/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gothic-13/")  
obviously, that is a condensed version, but possibly from the same family?

can anyone help me find this particular version? all i need are the cap letters.  
a mac postscript or open type version would be preferable.  
thanks so much. any assistance would be appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LCohenSongsLoveHate.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Church-y, gothic geometric sans with crossed "O" - Exocet {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/typophile.com/node/18778 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) square sans serif used in ESPN magazine - various similar {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/typophile.com/node/18769 "Go to next forum topic")
author: PaulNini

comments.content:
Probably no exact match. Here are similar big woody grots:

[Bureau Grotesque Seven Nine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.613.0.6&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LEONARD+COHEN&sampleSize=48)  
 [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series_g.html)  
 [Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=PRC.123352.0.7&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LEONARD+COHEN&sampleSize=48)  
 [Rhode](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.100194.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LEONARD+COHEN&sampleSize=48)  
 [Wormwood Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000269)  
 [Poplar](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.922.0.4)
Maybe try Hoefler and Frere Jones’s [Leviathan](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000049/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/leviathan/index.html).

The Solotype catalog lists a wood typeface it calls Chikamauga (likely a misspelling of Chickamauga - a US Civil War battlefield). It uses only the words MARKET FRESH for the showing, but the corresponding letters are perfect matches - most notably that R and S. I know of no digital version.

Many thanks to Miss Tiffany. I agree, Champion Heavyweight does appear to be the closest thing out there in the digital realm. I was familiar with some of the H&FJ faces, but not this one. I believe we can call the hunt off now, and much appreciation to everyone for the suggestions.  
Paul Nini  
Dept of Design  
Ohio State Univ
